data.title: Spelling Bee
data.statement:
Jeff is studying for a spelling bee, and he can't seem to remember how Greek and Latin origins impact the spelling of a word. Help him model it with a program so he can practice.

If the origin of the word is Latin: 
- A letter may sound like a "k", but it is always spelled with a "c"
- A letter may sound like a "s", but it is always spelled with a "sc"

If the word is in Greek: 
-  A letter may sound like a "i", but it is always spelled with a "y"
- A letter may sound like a "f", but it is always spelled with a "ph"
- A letter may sound like a "k", but it is always spelled with a "ch"

NOTE: IF THE CONDITIONS ALREADY SATISFY, DON'T CHANGE IT. For example, if a word is in Latin and the word already has a "sc" in it, keep it as it is (don't change the "s"). The word will always be in lowercase.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> Two space separated strings [[Origin]] and [[Word]] for the origin and what the word sounds like.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Jeff is studying for a spelling bee, and he can't seem to remember how Greek and Latin origins impact the spelling of a word. Help him model it with a program so he can practice.

If the origin of the word is Latin:
- A letter may sound like a "k", but it is always spelled with a "c"
- A letter may sound like a "s", but it is always spelled with a "sc"

If the word is in Greek:
- A letter may sound like a "i", but it is always spelled with a "y"
- A letter may sound like a "f", but it is always spelled with a "ph"
- A letter may sound like a "k", but it is always spelled with a "ch"

NOTE: IF THE CONDITIONS ALREADY SATISFY, DON'T CHANGE IT. For example, if a word is in Latin and the word already has a "sc" in it, keep it as it is (don't change the "s"). The word will always be in lowercase.
Input
Line 1: Two space separated strings Origin and Word for the origin and what the word sounds like.
Output
Output the actual words.
Constraints
Origin = "Latin" || "Greek"
0<Word.length<50
Example
Input
Latin laktate
Output
lactate
